      • getEntityName

        public java.lang.String getEntityName()
        The JPA entity's type.
        For example, entityName="BankAccount".
        By default, the entity name is deduced from the table name.
        For example: 'bank_account' will become 'BankAccount';

      • hasEntityName

        public boolean hasEntityName()

      • getSequenceName

        public java.lang.String getSequenceName()
        Allows you to specify the sequence name to use in order to generate this entity pk value. When a sequence name is provided the corresponding @SequenceGenerator and @GeneratedValue annotations are added to the primary key attribute.

      • hasSequenceName

        public boolean hasSequenceName()

      • getTableName

        public java.lang.String getTableName()
        The underlying table name for the entity. If not set, inheritance must be configured.

      • hasTableName

        public boolean hasTableName()

      • getIndexed

        public java.lang.Boolean getIndexed()
        Should this entity be annotated with hibernate search @Indexed annotation? False by default, unless if one columnConfig is marked as indexed.

      • hasTrueIndexed

        public boolean hasTrueIndexed()

        public java.util.List<Label> getLabels()
        The labels for this entity. They appear in the entity properties file located under 'src/main/resources/localization/domain'.

      • atLeastOneColumnConfigIsIndexed

        public boolean atLeastOneColumnConfigIsIndexed()

      • getMiddleTable

        public java.lang.Boolean getMiddleTable()
        By convention a table is considered as a many-to-many middle table if it has two foreign keys and no other regular columns. This attribute allows you to consider this table as a middle table, even if it has other regular columns. A regular column is a column that is neither a primary key nor a version (i.e. optimistic lock).

      • hasMiddleTable

        public boolean hasMiddleTable()

      • getComment

        public java.lang.String getComment()
        The comment that will be inserted in this entity's JavaDoc.

      • getRootPackage

        public java.lang.String getRootPackage()
        Allows you to override the default root package.
        Example: com.yourcompany

      • getSubPackage

        public java.lang.String getSubPackage()
        When you define a sub-package, the resulting entity's package becomes ".domain." instead of ".domain". There is no sub-package by default.

      • getLabel

        public java.lang.String getLabel()
        The base label for this entity. You may either set it here or in a nested labels/label.

      • getAssociationDirection

        public AssociationDirection getAssociationDirection()
        It is pertinent only if this entity's table plays the role of a middle table in a many-to-many association. In that case you can use this parameter to set the many-to-many association direction.

      • getColumnConfigs

        public java.util.List<ColumnConfig> getColumnConfigs()
        This entity's columnConfigs. Note that for entities without inheritance or for entities with a JOIN inheritance strategy, if a column is present in the table's meta data but has no corresponding entityConfig in this list, then an entityConfig is created by default and added automatically to this list.

      • hasColumnConfigs

        public boolean hasColumnConfigs()
